# AI Agent Instructions for Systems and Networks Website

## Project Overview
This is a website project for Systems and Networks content.

## Code Style and Conventions
- Use clear, descriptive variable and function names
- Follow consistent indentation (2 or 4 spaces)
- Add comments for complex logic
- Write self-documenting code where possible

## Development Guidelines
- Prioritize clean, maintainable code
- Follow best practices for the tech stack being used
- Ensure responsive design for all UI components
- Write accessible HTML with proper semantic elements

## Git Workflow
- Create feature branches from `main`
- Use descriptive commit messages
- Keep commits focused and atomic

## Documentation
- Update README.md when adding new features
- Keep inline documentation up to date

## Additional Notes
<!-- Add any project-specific instructions, preferences, or constraints here -->

## Global Project Context

You are an expert full-stack web developer.

Build a static, professional corporate website for an IT services company named "Systems & Networks".

### Project Constraints
- Pure HTML5, CSS3, Vanilla JavaScript
- No frameworks (no React, Bootstrap, Tailwind, etc.)
- No backend, no database
- Must run on Linux shared hosting (Apache)
- Mobile responsive
- Clean, corporate, professional look
- Target audience: Local & National businesses
- No contact form (email/phone only)

### Company Information
- 25+ years in IT services
- 30+ years of consultation experience
- Services: IT infrastructure, computers, laptops, servers, networking, IT rentals, domain & hosting reseller, professional email setup
- Clients: Startups to MNCs
